page.title: 11Housing of Blithfield area
page.content: The few homes in this area consist mainly o isolated farm houses most of which are about 200 years old and have been modernised. also houses are found in the small village of Admaston, the hamlet of Stockwell Heath, the edge of Colton Village and a group of about 16 houses at Seedcroft. Many of the old farm houses have had their land sold of to other farms. Most houses are priately owned, the owners borrowing money through a mortgage from a builing society. A few in Admaston and at Seedcroft are owned by the council and rented. Blithfield Hall is gradually being sold off. It is in a bad state of repair. The old coach houses and stable block have been convered into 7 small houses. Selling at about Â£60,000 each. Each house, 2 bedroom, 1 lounge, a kitchen with dining area, WC
